subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] An example of box that doesn't work [2 Attachments]
author: Zack Widup
full_text:
One thing I can say about spirits and spirit communication after a lot
of experience - they seem to be able to selectively choose who will
get a response and who won't. Why and how I don't understand. But I've
been in a room with 6 or 7 other people who are all within a few feet
of each other trying to record EVP's and only one gets a response.
Then 10 minutes later someone else does and the others do not.

I have also seen this with photographs. Some people will get a certain
thing on a photo and others taking a photo at the same time don't get
anything.

I imagine it's the same way with the box. Maybe whatever is
communicating through the box just doesn't like some people and won't
produce any messages for them.

Zack


On 11/9/11, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:
>  I have only one requirement, can I understand it? Seems to work ok to me.
> @ 5 seconds "Dead in Vietnam" and today there was a special on History
> about Vietnam war. So criticize all ya want, it still works just fine, any
> failure to receive messages is in the loose nut in front of the control
> panel. Point your finger at yourself when you tell how my stuff not work.
> Random mode is dead mode since we==on this group--discovered linear and
> manual sweep works much better. The voice recording was done by Misty, the
> actual owner of the group, by manual sweep. Yeah, wonder why I ain't
> impressed by claims of superior knowledge.
>
>  F-S
>
